talpiot-program.name: Felix Dothan
talpiot-program.bio: Physicist and IDF officer who co-founded the Talpiot program in 1979 to cultivate elite military technology talent.

talpiot-program.name: Shaul Yatziv
talpiot-program.bio: Hebrew University professor who helped design the Talpiot curriculum combining academic excellence with military service.

talpiot-program.name: Edward Fredkin
talpiot-program.bio: Computer scientist who advised early Talpiot cohorts on computing and artificial intelligence methodologies.

talpiot-program.name: Nahman Ash
talpiot-program.bio: Talpiot graduate who rose to prominence in Israel's defense establishment and public health leadership.

idb-holdings.name: Nochi Dankner
idb-holdings.bio: Controlled IDB Holdings through Ganden Holdings before losing the company amid financial difficulties and a market manipulation conviction.

idb-holdings.name: Eduardo Elsztain
idb-holdings.bio: Argentine businessman who acquired control of IDB Holdings' parent company Discount Investment Corporation.

idb-holdings.name: Shlomo Nehama
idb-holdings.bio: Longtime business executive involved in IDB Holdings' real estate subsidiary operations.

idb-holdings.name: Avraham Livnat
idb-holdings.bio: Served as CEO of IDB Holdings managing its diversified portfolio of companies across multiple sectors.

church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.name: Theophilos III
church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.bio: Patriarch of the Greek Orthodox Church of Jerusalem, one of the principal custodians of the Church of the Holy Sepulchre.

church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.name: Pierbattista Pizzaballa
church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.bio: Italian-born Latin Patriarch of Jerusalem overseeing Catholic interests in the Church of the Holy Sepulchre.

church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.name: Nourhan Manougian
church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.bio: Armenian Patriarch of Jerusalem representing the Armenian Apostolic Church's custodial rights at the holy site.

church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.name: Adeeb Joudeh
church-of-the-holy-sepulchre-jerusalem.bio: Member of the Muslim Joudeh family that has held the key to the Church of the Holy Sepulchre for centuries by tradition.

prime-minister-s-office.name: Benjamin Netanyahu
prime-minister-s-office.bio: Israel's longest-serving prime minister, leading the government through multiple terms since first taking office in 1996.

prime-minister-s-office.name: Yossi Shelley
prime-minister-s-office.bio: Senior civil servant who served as Director General of the Prime Minister's Office overseeing government operations.

prime-minister-s-office.name: Tzachi Braverman
prime-minister-s-office.role: Chief of Staff to the PM
prime-minister-s-office.bio: Long-serving chief of staff and close adviser to Prime Minister Netanyahu managing day-to-day office operations.

prime-minister-s-office.name: Eli Groner
prime-minister-s-office.bio: Former Director General of the Prime Minister's Office who later moved into senior roles in the private sector.

start-up-nation-ecosystem.name: Saul Singer
start-up-nation-ecosystem.bio: Journalist and author who co-wrote 'Start-Up Nation' popularizing Israel's innovation ecosystem globally.

start-up-nation-ecosystem.name: Dan Senor
start-up-nation-ecosystem.bio: Foreign policy adviser and author who co-wrote the influential book chronicling Israel's technology sector rise.

start-up-nation-ecosystem.name: Yossi Vardi
start-up-nation-ecosystem.bio: Veteran Israeli tech investor who backed ICQ and dozens of startups, considered a godfather of Israel's tech industry.

start-up-nation-ecosystem.name: Jon Medved
start-up-nation-ecosystem.bio: Founder and CEO of OurCrowd, a leading equity crowdfunding platform that channels global investment into Israeli startups.

reichman-university-idc-herzliya.name: Uriel Reichman
reichman-university-idc-herzliya.bio: Legal scholar who founded the Interdisciplinary Center Herzliya in 1994, later renamed Reichman University in his honor.

reichman-university-idc-herzliya.name: Rafi Melnick
reichman-university-idc-herzliya.bio: Economist and academic who served as president of Reichman University overseeing its growth into a major Israeli institution.

reichman-university-idc-herzliya.name: Alex Mintz
reichman-university-idc-herzliya.bio: Political scientist who served as provost and headed the Lauder School of Government, Diplomacy and Strategy at the university.

reichman-university-idc-herzliya.name: Boaz Ganor
reichman-university-idc-herzliya.bio: Counter-terrorism scholar who founded the International Institute for Counter-Terrorism at IDC Herzliya.

el-al-israel-airlines.name: Dina Ben Tal Ganancia
el-al-israel-airlines.bio: Appointed CEO of El Al in 2022, the first woman to lead Israel's national airline.

el-al-israel-airlines.name: Eli Defes
el-al-israel-airlines.bio: Served as CEO of El Al managing the airline through financial restructuring and fleet modernization efforts.

el-al-israel-airlines.name: Kenny Rozenberg
el-al-israel-airlines.bio: New York-based businessman who acquired a controlling stake in El Al Israel Airlines.

el-al-israel-airlines.name: David Maimon
el-al-israel-airlines.bio: Served as chairman of El Al's board of directors overseeing strategic decisions for Israel's flag carrier.

channel-13-reshet.name: Amos Regev
channel-13-reshet.bio: Media executive who led Reshet's operations including the Channel 13 news and entertainment broadcasts.

channel-13-reshet.name: Meshulam Riklis
channel-13-reshet.bio: Israeli-American businessman who was an early investor in Reshet broadcasting operations.

channel-13-reshet.name: Len Blavatnik
channel-13-reshet.bio: Ukrainian-born billionaire whose media holdings included ownership of Reshet, the operator of Channel 13 in Israel.

channel-13-reshet.name: Raviv Drucker
channel-13-reshet.bio: Award-winning investigative journalist and political commentator who became one of Channel 13's most prominent on-air figures.

ministry-of-defense.name: Yoav Gallant
ministry-of-defense.bio: Former IDF general who served as Israel's Minister of Defense overseeing military operations and defense policy.

ministry-of-defense.name: Eyal Zamir
ministry-of-defense.bio: Senior defense official who served as Director General of the Ministry of Defense managing its administrative functions.

ministry-of-defense.name: Amir Eshel
ministry-of-defense.bio: Former IAF commander who transitioned to serve as Director General of the Ministry of Defense.

ministry-of-defense.name: Moshe Dayan
ministry-of-defense.bio: Legendary IDF chief of staff and defense minister whose leadership during the Six-Day War made him an enduring symbol of Israeli defense.

mobileye-global.name: Amnon Shashua
mobileye-global.bio: Computer scientist and Hebrew University professor who co-founded Mobileye and leads its autonomous driving technology development.

mobileye-global.name: Ziv Aviram
mobileye-global.bio: Entrepreneur who co-founded Mobileye with Amnon Shashua and served as president until Intel's acquisition.

mobileye-global.name: Pat Gelsinger
mobileye-global.bio: Former Intel CEO who oversaw the $15.3 billion acquisition of Mobileye and its 2022 IPO as a publicly traded subsidiary.

mobileye-global.name: Nimrod Nehushtan
mobileye-global.bio: Senior executive at Mobileye responsible for global business development and strategic partnerships with automakers.

sodastream-israel.name: Daniel Birnbaum
sodastream-israel.bio: Led SodaStream's global transformation from a niche product to a mainstream brand before its acquisition by PepsiCo.

sodastream-israel.name: Eyal Shohat
sodastream-israel.bio: Took over leadership of SodaStream following its acquisition by PepsiCo to integrate and expand operations.

sodastream-israel.name: Ramon Laguarta
sodastream-israel.bio: CEO of PepsiCo which acquired SodaStream in 2018 for $3.2 billion to expand its at-home beverage platform.

sodastream-israel.name: Yonah Lloyd
sodastream-israel.bio: Long-serving executive at SodaStream who shaped the company's global branding and marketing strategy.

watergen.name: Michael Mirilashvili
watergen.bio: Israeli-Georgian billionaire who acquired Watergen and invested heavily in scaling its atmospheric water generation technology worldwide.

watergen.name: Maxim Pasik
watergen.bio: Led Watergen's executive operations driving the commercialization of atmospheric water generators for civilian and military use.

watergen.name: Arye Kohavi
watergen.bio: Israeli engineer and entrepreneur who founded Watergen developing technology to extract drinking water from air.

watergen.name: Nois Mirilashvili
watergen.bio: Senior executive at Watergen involved in strategic planning and international expansion of the company's water solutions.

biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.name: Ugur Sahin
biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.bio: Turkish-German physician and scientist who co-founded BioNTech and led the development of the COVID-19 mRNA vaccine.

biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.name: Albert Bourla
biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.bio: Greek-born veterinarian and CEO of Pfizer who oversaw the partnership with BioNTech and Israel's early mass vaccination campaign.

biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.name: Nachman Ash
biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.bio: Israeli brigadier general who coordinated the national vaccination rollout that made Israel a global case study in rapid immunization.

biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.name: Sharon Alroy-Preis
biontech-pfizer-israel-partnership.bio: Led Israel's public health response and served as key liaison with Pfizer for vaccine data sharing and distribution planning.

mekorot.name: Eli Cohen
mekorot.bio: Led Mekorot as CEO managing Israel's national water company and its critical water supply infrastructure.

mekorot.name: Alexander Kushnir
mekorot.bio: Served as chairman of Mekorot's board providing oversight of Israel's largest water utility operations.

mekorot.name: Yitzhak Aharonovitch
mekorot.bio: Former Israeli politician and police commissioner who served as chairman of Mekorot's board.

mekorot.name: Abraham Tene
mekorot.bio: Former CEO who expanded Mekorot's desalination and water recycling capabilities to strengthen Israel's water security.

western-wall-heritage-foundation.name: Shmuel Rabinovitch
western-wall-heritage-foundation.bio: Serves as the rabbi of the Western Wall and Holy Sites, overseeing religious activities at Judaism's holiest accessible site.

western-wall-heritage-foundation.name: Mordechai Eliav
western-wall-heritage-foundation.bio: Leads the Western Wall Heritage Foundation managing the site's preservation, tourism operations, and religious services.

western-wall-heritage-foundation.name: Natan Sharansky
western-wall-heritage-foundation.role: Former Chairman of Jewish Agency (Kotel Negotiations)
western-wall-heritage-foundation.bio: Former Soviet dissident who led negotiations over the egalitarian prayer section at the Western Wall as Jewish Agency chairman.

western-wall-heritage-foundation.name: Meir Lau
western-wall-heritage-foundation.bio: Holocaust survivor and former Ashkenazi Chief Rabbi who has been a prominent spiritual voice regarding the Western Wall's sanctity.

given-imaging-medtronic.name: Gavriel Iddan
given-imaging-medtronic.bio: Israeli electro-optical engineer who invented the PillCam capsule endoscopy technology at Given Imaging.

given-imaging-medtronic.name: Homi Shamir
given-imaging-medtronic.bio: Led Given Imaging as CEO through its growth phase and preparation for acquisition by Covidien/Medtronic.

given-imaging-medtronic.name: Geoffrey Martha
given-imaging-medtronic.bio: Chairman and CEO of Medtronic, the parent company that acquired Given Imaging through its Covidien merger.

given-imaging-medtronic.name: Glenda Dorchak
given-imaging-medtronic.bio: Technology executive who served as chairwoman of Given Imaging's board during its critical growth period.

israel-aerospace-industries-iai.name: Boaz Levy
israel-aerospace-industries-iai.bio: Longtime IAI executive who became president and CEO leading Israel's largest defense and aerospace manufacturer.

israel-aerospace-industries-iai.name: Amir Peretz
israel-aerospace-industries-iai.bio: Former defense minister and Labor party leader who served as chairman of IAI's board of directors.

israel-aerospace-industries-iai.name: Joseph Weiss
israel-aerospace-industries-iai.bio: Led IAI for over a decade expanding its satellite, UAV, and missile defense programs into global markets.

israel-aerospace-industries-iai.name: Al Bedein
israel-aerospace-industries-iai.bio: Defense industry veteran who served as chairman of IAI's board overseeing its strategic direction and government contracts.

hadassah-medical-center.name: Zeev Rotstein
hadassah-medical-center.bio: Led Hadassah Medical Center through financial recovery and expansion of its two hospital campuses in Jerusalem.

hadassah-medical-center.name: Yoram Weiss
hadassah-medical-center.bio: Senior physician and hospital administrator who serves as director general of Hadassah Medical Center.

hadassah-medical-center.name: Tamar Peretz
hadassah-medical-center.bio: Leading oncologist and researcher at Hadassah Medical Center heading its Sharett Institute of Oncology.

hadassah-medical-center.name: Rhoda Smolow
hadassah-medical-center.bio: President of Hadassah, the Women's Zionist Organization of America, the primary supporter of Hadassah Medical Center.

icl-group.name: Raviv Zoller
icl-group.bio: Leads ICL Group overseeing its specialty minerals and chemicals business based on Dead Sea mineral extraction.

icl-group.name: Aviram Lahav
icl-group.bio: Serves as chief financial officer of ICL Group managing the company's global financial operations and reporting.

icl-group.name: Johanna Lampe-Onnerud
icl-group.bio: Entrepreneur and board member of ICL Group bringing expertise in energy technology and sustainable innovation.

icl-group.name: Stefan Borgas
icl-group.bio: German-born executive who served as CEO of ICL Group driving its transformation into a global specialty minerals company.

verint-systems.name: Dan Bodner
verint-systems.bio: Longtime leader of Verint Systems who transformed the company from an intelligence-focused firm to a customer engagement platform.

verint-systems.name: Elan Moriah
verint-systems.role: Former President of Video and Cyber Intelligence
verint-systems.bio: Senior executive who led Verint's security intelligence division before its spin-off as Cognyte.

verint-systems.name: Grant Highlander
verint-systems.bio: Chief financial officer of Verint Systems managing the company's financial strategy and investor relations.

verint-systems.name: Elad Sharon
verint-systems.bio: Leads Cognyte Software, the security analytics company spun off from Verint Systems in 2021.

discount-investment-corporation.name: Eduardo Elsztain
discount-investment-corporation.bio: Argentine real estate mogul who gained control of Discount Investment Corporation through IDB Holdings.

discount-investment-corporation.name: Giora Oron
discount-investment-corporation.bio: Served as CEO of Discount Investment Corporation managing its diverse portfolio of Israeli industrial and technology companies.

discount-investment-corporation.name: Haim Gueron
discount-investment-corporation.bio: Longtime chairman who oversaw Discount Investment Corporation's portfolio spanning telecom, real estate, and industry.

discount-investment-corporation.name: Zvi Sheleg
discount-investment-corporation.bio: Senior board member of Discount Investment Corporation involved in strategic investment decisions.

mellanox-technologies-nvidia.name: Eyal Waldman
mellanox-technologies-nvidia.bio: Co-founded Mellanox Technologies and led it for two decades until its $6.9 billion acquisition by Nvidia in 2020.

mellanox-technologies-nvidia.name: Jensen Huang
mellanox-technologies-nvidia.bio: Co-founder and CEO of Nvidia who acquired Mellanox to integrate high-speed networking into Nvidia's data center ecosystem.

mellanox-technologies-nvidia.name: Michael Kagan
mellanox-technologies-nvidia.bio: Co-founder of Mellanox who became Nvidia's chief technology officer for networking after the acquisition.

mellanox-technologies-nvidia.name: Amit Katz
mellanox-technologies-nvidia.role: VP of Israel Operations at Nvidia
mellanox-technologies-nvidia.bio: Senior executive managing Nvidia's expanding Israel operations built on the foundation of the Mellanox acquisition.

galei-zahal-idf-radio.name: Ilana Dayan
galei-zahal-idf-radio.bio: One of Israel's foremost investigative journalists who began her career at Galei Zahal before leading flagship TV programs.

galei-zahal-idf-radio.name: Roni Daniel
galei-zahal-idf-radio.bio: Legendary Israeli military correspondent who served at Galei Zahal and became the voice of defense reporting in Israel.

galei-zahal-idf-radio.name: Keren Neubach
galei-zahal-idf-radio.bio: Popular radio presenter who hosted morning shows on Galei Zahal becoming one of Israeli media's most recognized voices.

galei-zahal-idf-radio.name: Efi Triger
galei-zahal-idf-radio.bio: Served as commander of the IDF radio station overseeing its editorial direction and broadcast operations.

osem-nestl.name: Avi Ben Assayag
osem-nestl.bio: Led Osem-Nestle as CEO managing Israel's largest food manufacturer and its extensive product portfolio.

osem-nestl.name: Dan Propper
osem-nestl.bio: Longtime chairman of Osem who oversaw its growth and the strategic partnership with Nestle leading to full acquisition.

osem-nestl.name: Mark Schneider
osem-nestl.bio: CEO of Nestle which fully acquired Osem making it a wholly-owned subsidiary of the Swiss food giant.

osem-nestl.name: Guy Laurence
osem-nestl.bio: Senior Nestle executive overseeing the zone that includes Osem's operations in Israel and regional markets.

storedot.name: Doron Myersdorf
storedot.bio: Co-founded StoreDot and leads its mission to develop extreme fast-charging battery technology for electric vehicles.

storedot.name: Simon Litsyn
storedot.bio: Tel Aviv University professor who co-founded StoreDot bringing deep expertise in signal processing and nanotechnology.

storedot.name: Gil Arditi
storedot.bio: Co-founded StoreDot contributing to the early research and development of its rapid-charging battery materials.

storedot.name: Hernan Kazah
storedot.bio: Co-founder of MercadoLibre and Kaszek Ventures who serves on StoreDot's board as a strategic investor.

varonis-systems.name: Yaki Faitelson
varonis-systems.bio: Co-founded Varonis Systems and leads the company as CEO building it into a major data security and analytics platform.

varonis-systems.name: Ohad Korkus
varonis-systems.bio: Co-founded Varonis and serves as chief technology officer driving the company's data protection technology development.

varonis-systems.name: Guy Melamed
varonis-systems.bio: Serves as chief financial officer and chief operating officer of Varonis managing its financial and operational strategy.

varonis-systems.name: David Bass
varonis-systems.bio: Executive vice president of engineering at Varonis overseeing product development and technical architecture.
